Hallo Chitral,
I also obtained different initial coverages with Chemkin and=
 
Cantera, and that led to a significantly different output 
composition, i=
f put in a PFR model.
I tried to make the same calculations in Chemkin with=
out the Motz-
Wise correction in the definition of the sticking coefficient=
's 
reaction rate, and this time I got identical numbers from the two 
soft=
wares. So, it seems to me that this can be an explanation for 
the differen=
ces: Cantera probably implements the sticking 
coefficients without Motz-Wi=
se correction.
Daniela
